marketNews.title: ASII: Wholesales Toyota + Daihatsu -17% YoY, -10% MoM in November 2024
marketNews.content: Gaikindo reported that domestic car wholesales in November 2024 reached 74,347 units (down 12% YoY, down 4% MoM). This result makes the 11-month cumulative wholesales 784,755 units (down 15% YoY), equal to 92.3% of the revised 2024 target of 850,000 units (previous target 1.1 million units). The Indonesian Motorcycle Industry Association (AISI) reported that domestic motorcycle sales reached 512,942 units (down 10.3% YoY, down 5.8% MoM) in November 2024. The 11-month cumulative motorcycle sales reached 5.9 million units (up 2.1% YoY), equal to 91-96% of the 2024 AISI target of 6.2-6.5 million units. Bank Indonesia reported that the Consumer Confidence Index rose to 125.9 in November 2024 (October 2024: 121.1), the highest level since April 2024, driven by a smooth transition of the new government with all sub-indices strengthening. China's consumer price index inflation slowed to 0.2% YoY in November 2024 (October 2024: 0.3% YoY), lower than the consensus expectation of 0.5% YoY and the lowest since June 2024. Monthly, China experienced deflation of 0.6% MoM (October 2024: deflation 0.3% MoM), worse than the consensus expectation of 0.4% MoM. Core inflation was flat month-on-month (October 2024: deflation 0.1% MoM), while annual core inflation rose to 0.3% YoY (October 2024: 0.2% YoY), the highest in three months. The U.S. Bureau of Labor Statistics reported that non-farm payrolls increased by 227,000 in November 2024, above the consensus expectation of 200,000, up sharply from 36,000 in October 2024, which had been affected by a Boeing strike and storms Helene and Milton. The U.S. unemployment rate rose to 4.2% in November 2024 (October 2024: 4.1%). A rebel group in Syria succeeded in overthrowing President Bashar al-Assad on Sunday (8/12) after launching a two-week intensive attack; Assad fled to Moscow, Russia, and is expected to receive asylum there. The CEO of MIND ID, Hendi Prio Santoso, called for an immediate government moratorium on the construction of nickel smelters (RKEF) to prevent oversupply of ferronickel and nickel pig iron, noting that current ferronickel prices no longer cover production costs.

tickerNews.title: UNVR provides detailed follow-up on ice-cream business sale
tickerNews.content: On 25 November 2024, Unilever Indonesia (UNVR) announced a sale agreement for its ice-cream business valued at IDR 7 trillion (excluding VAT), which we previously covered in a Stockbit Commentary. UNVR has now released further details about the transaction. Key points: • Ice-cream business contributed 9.5% of 2023 revenue, with negative sales growth of -2% CAGR from 2019-2023; market share fell from 69.2% in 2019 to 61.9% in 9M24. The decline in ice-cream sales was slightly better than UNVR’s overall sales decline of -2.6% CAGR over the same period. Profitability of the ice-cream business fell from 11.1% in 2019 to 7.2% in 2023, roughly a mid-high single-digit level. The business generated approximately IDR 264 billion profit in 2023, implying a transaction valuation of 26.5x P/E. • Potential additional dividend with an implied yield of 5.3% – UNVR plans to distribute the net proceeds of the transaction as cash dividend after closing. Pro-forma financials show a profit of IDR 3.8 trillion (after tax) from the sale, which, if fully paid out, yields a dividend yield of 5.3% based on the closing price of IDR 1,870 per share on Friday 6 December. The exact closing date of the transaction has not been announced; the shareholders’ meeting for approval is scheduled for 14 January 2025. Key Takeaway: We view the ice-cream business sale as positive for UNVR. The divestiture allows the company to focus on its core operations, and the 26.5x P/E valuation is considered premium given the negative growth and lower profitability of the business. For comparison, Campina Ice Cream Industry (CAMP) trades at 21.4x P/E (TTM) as of today’s close, Monday 9 December. On the day of this article, UNVR shares closed up 1.34% at IDR 1,895 per share. *This article was first released as a Stockbit Commentary on Monday 9 December morning.*

tickerNews.title: ASII reports Toyota and Daihatsu wholesale sales decline in November 2024
tickerNews.content: Astra International (ASII) recorded Toyota wholesale sales of 26,984 units (down 13% YoY, down 0.2% MoM) in November 2024, while Daihatsu wholesale sales reached 10,030 units (down 26% YoY, down 29% MoM). Combined, the two main brands posted a sales decline of -17% YoY and -10% MoM in November 2024, worse than the industry average of -12% YoY and -3.7% MoM, resulting in a combined market share drop to 49.8% (October 2024: 53.3%, November 2023: 52.7%). Cumulatively for the first 11 months of 2024, Toyota wholesales totaled 262,315 units (down 14% YoY) and Daihatsu 149,975 units (down 14.4% YoY).

tickerNews.title: HEAL directors Yulisar Khiat and Tan Suryanti Gunadi purchase shares in November-December 2024
tickerNews.content: Directors of Medikaloka Hermina, Yulisar Khiat and Tan Suryanti Gunadi, each bought shares of HEAL. Yulisar purchased 6.3 million shares at an average price of IDR 1,395.2 per share, and Tan bought 80,000 shares at an average price of IDR 1,445 per share on 21-22 November 2024 and 2 December 2024 respectively. The transaction values are approximately IDR 8.8 billion for Yulisar and IDR 116 million for Tan. After the purchases, Yulisar’s ownership increased from 12.72% to 12.76%, while Tan’s ownership rose from 0.028% to 0.0286%.

tickerNews.title: BYAN announces interim dividend for 2024
tickerNews.content: Bayan Resources (BYAN) will distribute an interim dividend for fiscal year 2024 amounting to USD 300 million or USD 0.009 per share, equivalent to IDR 142.8 per share assuming an exchange rate of IDR 15,861 per USD. The cum-date is on the regular market and negotiation on 17 December 2024, with payment scheduled for 8 January 2025. Based on BYAN’s closing price on Monday 9 December at IDR 19,900 per share, the implied dividend yield is 0.72%.

tickerNews.title: SSIA acquires approximately 14.8 million NRCA shares
tickerNews.content: Surya Semesta Internusa (SSIA) purchased about 14.8 million shares of Nusa Raya Cipta (NRCA) at IDR 360 per share from its subsidiary PT Enercon Paradhya International on 4 December 2024. The transaction value is roughly IDR 5.3 billion. After the transaction, SSIA’s ownership in NRCA increased from 63.35% to 64.36%.

tickerNews.title: SGER plans to expand commodity trading business
tickerNews.content: The President Director of Sumber Global Energy, Welly Thomas, stated that the company will conduct metal commodity trading – such as silver and copper – through its Singapore-based subsidiary Hineni Resources Pte. Ltd. The diversification aims to develop SGER’s business model into a more diversified commodity company beyond its core focus on coal trading.

tickerNews.title: MSJA shares purchased by PT Maju Selaras Jaya Merta
tickerNews.content: The controlling shareholder of Multi Spunindo Jaya, PT Maju Selaras Jaya Merta, bought 187.5 million shares of MSJA at IDR 350 per share between 3-5 December 2024. The transaction value is approximately IDR 65.6 billion. After the purchase, PT Maju Selaras Jaya Merta’s ownership in MSJA increased from 54.91% to 58.1%.

tickerNews.title: NSSS shares purchased by PT Samuel Tumbuh Bersama
tickerNews.content: Shareholders of Nusantara Sawit Sejahtera, PT Samuel Tumbuh Bersama, bought approximately 2.6 billion shares of NSSS at an average price of IDR 190 per share on 28 November 2024. The transaction value is about IDR 488 billion. After the purchase, PT Samuel Tumbuh Bersama’s ownership in NSSS rose from 38.83% to 49.64%.

tickerNews.title: SAMF announces 1:2 stock split to be effective February 2025
tickerNews.content: Saraswanti Anugerah Makmur (SAMF) plans a stock split with a ratio of 1:2. Trading with the new nominal value will begin on the regular market and negotiation market on 6 February 2025. The plan will be discussed at the Extraordinary General Meeting of Shareholders (RUPSLB) on 16 January 2025.

tickerNews.title: CNKO shares acquired by Anderson Bay Pte. Ltd.
tickerNews.content: Anderson Bay Pte. Ltd. purchased 896 million shares of Exploitasi Energi Indonesia (CNKO) at IDR 7 per share between 2-4 December 2024. The transaction value is approximately IDR 6.3 billion. After the acquisition, Anderson Bay’s ownership in CNKO increased from zero to 10%, becoming the new controlling shareholder. The company will subsequently conduct a mandatory tender offer.
